intro: Vilfa robusta, commonly known as the robust vilfa, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, hairy texture. The leaves are lance-shaped, with a waxy surface and a deep green color, often arranged alternately along the stem. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pale yellow, blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to gardens and natural habitats.
